results.title: Margaret Evelyn Walker
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Dance: Videos of Australian dancers and choreographers”.
Margaret Evelyn Walker is one of the best loved figures in dance in Australia. She discusses her travels in Eastern Europe in the 1940’s and 1950’s, her belief in the power of folk music, her struggles to have it accepted as a subject in schools and of the establishment of the Australian Association for Dance Education. Interview conducted by James Murdoch.

results.title: As a matter of fact: a film about abortion
results.creator_credit: Robyn Dryen, Susan Lambert, Creative Development Branch of Australian Film Commission, Womens Film Fund and Women's Health Resources Foundation
results.brief_description: A documentary about a feminist run abortion clinic. Counselling is shown to be an important part of the procedure, which is carried out using local anaesthetic and the vacuum aspiration method. We follow one woman through the termination of her pregnancy, and other women tell why they chose to have an abortion. The film ends with an animated section on the struggle for free, legalised abortion in Australia and information on what to do and where to go if you are pregnant.
results.title_for_label: As a matter of fact: a film about abortion

results.title: Fatness, foods, fads (compilation)
results.brief_description: Fatness, foods and fads outlines the 5 food groups and examines the fallacies of diets such as the Israeli army diet, the no carbohydrate diet, the grapefruit diet and the macrobiotic diet. 2. “Energy, food and exercise” shows how to achieve a proper balance of food and exercise for particular needs. 3.”Whats cooking” highlights the health problems that abound in the unhygienic kitchen and poses solutions. Compared by Andrew Daddo.

results.title: Our fragile coast and a question of balance
results.creator_credit: David Hughes and Victoria. Dept. of Education and Early Childhood Development
results.brief_description: The first half of this compilation tape focuses on erosion and deposition at Port Campbell, the Gippsland Lakes and Port Phillip, to be used in conjunction with the Earth in Action topic of the Year 12 Geography course; the second shows how competing human interests could destroy the coastal ecology.

results.title: Manning Clark
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Videos on Australian Writers: archival writers series II”.
Author and historian Manning Clark recalls the events of his early childhood, the attitudes of his family and how they influenced his writing. He speaks at length about the process of researching and writing his multi- volume History of Australia and how his outlook changed over the years of writing it. He speaks candidly about the public reaction to his work and addresses his critics. Interviewed by James Murdoch during Australia’s bicentennial year, 1988, Clark reflects on the past and expresses his hopes for the future of Australian society.

results.title: In search of a landscape
results.creator_credit: Swinburne Institute of Technology. Film and Television School and Hannah Dunne
results.brief_description: The pre-performance preparations by Hannah Dunne and her dance troupe as they practice for their performance of “In search of a landscape”. Hannah describes to the viewer how she arrived at the name for this particular piece. NB: This video was donated by the performer and has a grainy quality. You do not need to adjust your machine.

results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Australia Council archival film series: writers I”.
A charming film of poet Gwen Harwood speaking at her home in Tasmania about her work in poetry and her love for music and opera.

results.title: Tor Schwanck: gold and silversmith
results.creator_credit: Terry McMahon, Nina Syme and Victorian Film Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Craft as a Livelihood”
Metal-work has been in Tor Schwanck’s family since the 15th century. He is an artisan trained in all aspects of metal-work. Schwanck uses non-precious metals as well as gold and silver. All the designs are originals, and he tours, exhibits and receives commissions for his work.
